WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! The whole EP is up on Spotify, iTunes, etc Please share!

So I just released my first EP about 2 weeks ago (bad timing, I know). Wrote all the songs myself with some edits/suggestions from my producer. I #8217;ve taken a few music courses and read several books on songwriting. Hired some really sick session players for the record and picked this song to share since its got three verses, a bridge and a chorus (which is about as complex as I get). Entire EP is up on iTunes, Spotify, etc Hope you enjoy.

IG: tonyjrandthemagicvalley Let me know if you have any more questions. I #8217;m just here at home in quarantine like everyone else!

WRITING.TITLE: Time to upgrade?
WRITING.TEXT: I have a set of Hohner Marine Band Special 20s that I bought about a decade ago. I haven #8217;t actually played on them much, but they #8217;ve certainly been exposed to high heat and humidity (Texas). I #8217;ve started to become a little more serious in playing them and I #8217;m wondering if they are outdated, cheap, possibly warped and curious about what someone might recommend for an upgrade. If it matters I play straight harp in a country/Americana singer/songwriter vibe. Thanks in advance. Tony

Yes they do but I feel like some play #8220;smoother #8221; than others. And that #8217;s really what I #8217;m wondering if investing in something more expensive would improve playability. I might just be trying to compensate for my skill level.
Thanks. Never cleaned them before and they do smell. Do you recommend a commercial product or DIY solution?
Cheap sausage cooked in plastic. Brings back memories. Let me guess....it makes it more juicy? That shit is already 60% fat dude

My theory I and II courses both utilized the textbook tonal harmony by Stefan Kostka. You basically start by memorizing scales and how to describe intervals (minor second, major second, and so on) Then you learn the different chord structures (minor/major/dim/aug) You learn 7ths later Then you learn chord progressions Something like that Ideally all while being able to see it on paper and singing (ear training/sight singing/hell)

His book is part of my required readings for my psych course. I #8217;ve spent over a decade studying and teaching psychology and I vote Democrat. I don #8217;t know what he teaches cops, but his book checks out.

You must be a scientist since you are so quick to use the term pseudoscience. I assume you #8217;re not so much a scientist as someone with internet access and a Wikipedia type education who thinks they have a perspective worth offering.

Well, I certainly wouldn #8217;t challenge anything you have to say in the field of climatology because that is your field of study, not mine. I #8217;d appreciate the same respect toward someone in my position in the field of social sciences, because that #8217;s exactly what this topic is about. Yes, my field has some quacks, as I #8217;m sure there are some climatologists that don #8217;t believe in climate change, but this dude isn #8217;t a quack as far as I know (which is just his book). I think we would all be better off, however, accepting that we are not all health care professionals or constitutional lawyers or climatologists or social scientists, and give those professionals the benefit of the doubt. With that said, this dude #8217;s book is well written with some solid arguments. You have read the book, right? If you haven #8217;t just google #8220;On Killing PDF #8221; and you should be able to find a digital copy floating around. It #8217;s an easy read. PS - I edited this like 7 times to improve grammar and remove some condescending shit

Certainly open to food experiences or cultural exhibits though. Plantation tours seem a little weird to me but if you want to try and sell me on one, have at it.
I #8217;m sure I #8217;d learn something at Auschwitz. Not interested in a tour. Thanks
I live in Texas. My coworker is from SC and used to make me boiled peanuts. I miss that.

Can V7-IV work? That #8217;s it. I know V7-I is a great resolution, but I got a progression in chorus I #8217;m working on in 4/4...And it #8217;s presented below. Key of F# if it matters IV-IV-I-I I-I-V7-V7 IV-I-V7-I IV-V7-I-I As you can see the only questionable progression is V7-IV to begin the third line where things pick up. Sounds to good to me but as much as I #8217;ve been told that #8217;s all that matters, I #8217;d like some input.

I think you need to establish the key. Assuming it #8217;s key of G. You have a progressions of IV-V-I-iv Very popular for progression for a chorus Not sure what it #8217;s #8220;called #8221; other than that

Maybe I am being dense. Maybe my assumptions about plantations are wrong. I #8217;m sure they employ (not at all ironically) lots of POC. I #8217;m sure they host beautiful weddings (for white people), and I #8217;m sure the tourist population is representative of the general population and not all dominated by middle class white people. Truthfully, I don #8217;t have a problem personally paying to tour a beautiful estate, but I #8217;m sure it #8217;s not a pleasant experience for the vast majority of SC #8217;s AA population, and for that reason I #8217;m out. PS - sorry not sorry your oppressive history is being eradicated day by day. If you have any recommendations for nature sites (away from town) LMK.

A visit to the doctor without insurance will probably cost you a couple hundred bucks, and the doctor will be able to write you a prescription for anti anxiety medication. Generic Xanax (alprazolam) will run about $80 without insurance but I think there are actually coupons that will bring it down to $30. This price is for 30 pills that you should take as needed when your anxiety is bad but are easily addictive. Because it is an addictive and controlled substance, your doctor will probably not allow you to get refills and you will have to see him/her again to get a refill. I #8217;ve never gotten meds in MX and I #8217;m not sure if they will require a prescription, but that seems like it might be your best option (even if you have to see a Mexican doctor to get a script) Im sorry about your situation, but know that your reason for anxiety is NOT stupid. I have a masters degree in psychology and teach psychology for a living, but I am not a doctor or a clinical psychologist (therapist). I also have my own prescription for alprazolam.

A couple of people have mentioned that in MX you will get #8220;full bars #8221;. These are long white pills that are basically 4x the size of what I take for my anxiety as needed, and therefore extremely addictive. Having a trusted and responsible family member break them down and manage your access is worth considering.

WRITING.TITLE: First time experience was positive. Need to know where to go from here
WRITING.TEXT: Just had my first CBD experience. I locally purchased two pre-rolled 1 gram spliffs for a total of $24. The vendor basically said it was the best they had. I got a Sativa strain called Maui Haze and an Indica strain called Stormy Daniels. Vendor told me there were each about 25% CBD. I just smoked the entire Sativa strain over 2 sessions while I played guitar (I #8217;m a songwriter that plays about 4 hours a day). It felt pretty good, dare I say great. Still does. I smoked marijuana daily for about 10 years and that #8217;s not an option for me right now for many reasons, but anyway, it certainly was nostalgic, but I absolutely also felt a physiological and psychological effect. Not completely unlike marijuana, just much more mild and pleasant in that I didn #8217;t feel like my cognitive functioning or coordination was impaired, if anything it was enhanced. My creativity was certainly enhanced, my short term memory may have been slightly impaired. I feel like my awareness of time passing was also slightly affected. Again, not completely unlike marijuana. Anyway, I #8217;ll probably try the Sativa strain tonight. My questions are: 1.) What kind of value did I get? 2.) Is anyone familiar with these strains, and could you share your experience? 3.) Do you have any recommendations for other brands, strains, products or vendors?

WRITING.TEXT: Did you cook the tomatillos or jalape #241;os? I always cook mine. Roasted or boiled. Roasted preferred
Cumin, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, chili powder (skip the cayenne)

Oh man. Just boil the tomatillos and jalape #241;os together for about 12 minutes or throw them under the broiler on a sheet pan to get them charred up. You #8217;ll want to keep an eye on them and turn them once they get some black on them. Either way you will get a more balanced salsa with deeper flavor. Raw tomatillos can be a bit too acidic and sour. Leave that to the lime juice.

Man I think that #8217;s so cool you want to make Mexican food in Saudi. You may want to consider making a #8220;fusion #8221; to compensate for the lack of ingredients. No one wants bad bread of any kind, so you may want to use the Middle East equivalent of a tortilla

Go with flour. Good corn tortillas are very hard to find or make. Also, if you have easy access to eggs, you should consider breakfast tacos with flour tortillas. Breakfast tacos are more common in northern Mexico and south Texas. Look up #8220;Laredo Taco Company #8221;

Anyone know from an operant conditioning perspective how birds are trained to do this?

Very cool. I teach psychology, but this was not obvious to me. When talking about biological influences on learning, a more common focus of behaviorism is #8220;instinctual drift #8221; which is a type of regression in learning due to innate or natural tendencies. Seems falconry uses this to its advantage. Edit: didn #8217;t even notice there was food in the guys hand Still makes me wonder how they teach the command association.

Thank you and sorry. If I new how to delete or move the post I would

I understand the issue. I think my options are an AirBnB with a reasonable monthly rate, a hotel at probably 4 times the amount, or not go at all. I suppose I could meet a stranger on Craigslist looking for a month long roommate...

I had deleted my Marriott comment because I had realized the point you just made. You were quick to respond though, but you #8217;re right. And as a favor to you, I #8217;m no longer doing this month long stay, because I can #8217;t afford to stay at a hotel for a month. Do me a favor and tip extra in January to make up for all the tips I won #8217;t be leaving, since I won #8217;t be there. Make sure to buy an extra cup of coffee every morning in January at a local coffee shop like I had planned to do. Make sure to tip the buskers (if there are any), like I would have done. So which is it? Stay home and keep my money in TX or use AirBnB?

Also want to point out that the musician whose house in Bywater that I stayed at using AirBNB last year didn #8217;t seem to mind the extra cash in his pocket. As someone who has rented a room on AirBNB I #8217;m familiar with the system; and that local musician had a few extra hundred dollars in his pocket that he otherwise wouldn #8217;t have had. What he does with the money is up to him. Ultimately the greater economy of NOLA is not the responsibility of a single tourist. Seems to me your issue should be directed with local politicians.
Gladly. Seems every day I get a little closer to voting republican.

You definitely used the right word in #8220;imprinting #8221;. When we discuss attachment in psychology it is usually prefaced with Konrad Lorenz #8217;s work in imprinting, but we quickly jump to the concept of attachment. Usually starting with Harry Harlows study with baby monkeys (one of my favorite studies). Ultimately this all debatable, but I think my position is that birds imprint on a strictly biological basis, and mammals form attachments that involve both biological and socioemotional processes. Please look up Harlows study! There are some great videos on YouTube using research footage. Edit:grammar

Considering Investing in Soko
WRITING.TEXT: I am considering investing in the Soko project being developed by Ava Patrimonio. www.sokotulum.com Anyone familiar with the project or developer? Anyone able to offer advice on someone from the US purchasing a condo in Tulum?
www.sokotulum.com

I was just down there looking at properties. Didn #8217;t see much in the way of a #8220;steal #8221;. Condos we saw were going for 175K. SOKO is a new development still under construction with presale units going for 150K-200K. Not sure how these prices compare to what is #8220;normal #8221;, but my OP had broken link, so here is is if you are interested in seeing the location www.sokotulum.com

I certainly appreciate your candidness. For what it #8217;s worth we are in our mid 30s and own a couple of homes so the risk isn #8217;t as high for us. I #8217;ve certainly heard horror stories of new developments being abandoned, which is why I came here searching peace of mind. Still looking....
The place that was next to the bus station was the best! Anyone know if they relocated???
For your own safety stay away from movie theaters, schools, churches, concerts, political rallies....oh, you said Tulum. You #8217;ll be fine.

Our intention is to use it as both. My understanding is that part of the purchase includes rental management for the first two years so we will be renting it out heavily on the front end. I #8217;d be surprised if we spent more than 2-3 months out of the year there As for the price per square foot, I don #8217;t know. My wife is handing the details. It seems on par with most of the Aldea Zama stuff.
I think it #8217;s like 30 some units being constructed together with an estimated completion of May2021.
I forgot the name but it was literally 2-3 spaces down (north) from the bus station and it was a wide open space. I think it #8217;s like an electronics store now.
I found the project director #8217;s LinkedIn. Makes me feel better, I guess? https://mx.linkedin.com/in/mauricio-rivera-arreola-33483633

I don #8217;t mind a shoebox. There are some nice shoeboxes out there. You look at any major city in the US....shoeboxes half as nice going for twice the price. As for the ROI I #8217;m not really sure how common for those numbers to be put in writing. Maybe it #8217;s common, maybe it #8217;s included here, I just don #8217;t know. As for paying taxes, I #8217;m fine with that too. I #8217;m no colonizer, and furthermore my wife holds Mexican citizenship. We are just very Americanized and from a business perspective we might as well be outsiders.

A little bit of cynicism is safe I think. Ultimately it comes down to my wife and I having a lot of money to use for investment, and buying the house next door just doesn #8217;t seem to be the way for us.
Translation: don #8217;t get too excited, but it #8217;s gonna be badass
Ahhh...mental health. Such a privilege.

I love Tulum. And I hope it doesn #8217;t become Playa del Carmen, although I think we all know it will slowly be moving in that direction for the next 20 years. With that said, as long as my purchase is legitimate, I expect someone to make me an offer somewhere down the line.
